questions.title: Design a Highly Available URL Shortener
questions.prompt: Design a URL shortener that supports billions of reads/day, strong abuse prevention, and high availability.
followups: How do you generate unique short codes at scale?
How do you handle hot keys and caching strategy?
How do you prevent abuse and spam?

questions.title: Design a Distributed Rate Limiter
questions.prompt: Design a distributed rate limiter across multiple regions with good accuracy under failures.
followups: How do you handle clock skew?
Token bucket vs sliding window trade-offs?
How do you avoid a single point of failure?

questions.title: Design a Durable Event Processing System
questions.prompt: Design an event processing system with replay support and strong operational reliability.
followups: At-least-once vs exactly-once processing?
How do you design idempotency keys?
How do you handle schema evolution?

questions.title: Design a Large-Scale Notification Platform
questions.prompt: Design a notifications platform supporting email/SMS/push with retries, throttling, and user preferences.
followups: How do you prevent over-sending and respect preferences?
How do you handle provider outages and retries safely?
How do you ensure idempotency and deduplication?

questions.title: Debugging: Heisenbug Under Load
questions.prompt: A bug appears only under heavy load and disappears when logging is enabled. Describe how you would find the root cause and ship a safe fix.
followups: What low-overhead signals would you add?
How do you reproduce deterministically?
How do you roll out the fix safely?

questions.title: Tail Latency (p99) Investigation
questions.prompt: A service meets average latency but fails p99 targets. Explain how you diagnose and reduce tail latency.
followups: What causes tail latency in distributed systems?
How do you instrument tracing effectively?
What mitigations reduce p99 without hurting throughput?

questions.title: Concurrent Data Structure: Thread-Safe Cache
questions.prompt: Design a thread-safe cache with minimal contention that supports read-heavy workloads.
followups: What lock granularity do you choose and why?
How do you prevent deadlocks?
How do you measure contention and throughput?

questions.title: Design a Multi-Tenant Service
questions.prompt: Design a multi-tenant SaaS service for enterprise customers: data isolation, scaling, and noisy-neighbor mitigation.
followups: Shared DB vs DB-per-tenant trade-offs?
How do you enforce isolation and access control?
How do you handle backups and restores per tenant?

questions.title: Distributed Cache Invalidation Strategy
questions.prompt: Design a caching layer in front of a database and describe invalidation/consistency strategies under concurrent updates.
followups: Write-through vs write-back vs cache-aside?
How do you avoid cache stampedes?
What consistency model do you target and why?

questions.title: Graph: Critical Connections
questions.prompt: Given an undirected graph, find all critical connections whose removal disconnects the graph.
followups: What are low-link values conceptually?
Why is DFS the right tool here?
Time and space complexity?

questions.title: DP: Edit Distance
questions.prompt: Given two strings, compute the minimum number of edits (insert/delete/replace) to convert one into the other.
followups: Define your DP state clearly.
How do you optimize space?
What edge cases do you test?

questions.title: DP: Burst Balloons
questions.prompt: Given balloons with values, maximize coins by bursting them in optimal order.
followups: What is the subproblem definition?
Why does greedy fail?
What is the complexity?

questions.title: Design a Secure Auth System
questions.prompt: Design authentication for web/mobile: login, token issuance, refresh, revocation, and secure storage.
followups: How do you defend against token theft?
How do you rotate keys and revoke sessions?
How do you store tokens safely on device?

questions.title: Large-Scale Data Migration Plan
questions.prompt: You must migrate billions of records to a new schema with minimal downtime. Outline a safe plan.
followups: How do you validate correctness during migration?
How do you do rollback safely?
What metrics do you monitor?

questions.title: Design a Search Service (High Level)
questions.prompt: Design a search service that supports indexing, querying, ranking, and pagination with operational considerations.
followups: How do you build and update the index?
How do you handle hot queries and caching?
How do you fight spam/abuse?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Dive Deep (Hard Case)
questions.prompt: Tell me about the hardest root-cause analysis you’ve done. What data did you use and how did you confirm the fix?
followups: How did you prove causality (not correlation)?
What was the long-term preventative change?
How did you communicate the incident?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Ownership (Failure Scenario)
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you owned a failure. What happened, what did you do immediately, and what changed afterward?
followups: How did you manage stakeholders?
What did you change in process/tech to prevent recurrence?
What did you learn?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Insist on the Highest Standards (Pushback)
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you pushed for higher standards and faced pushback. How did you handle it?
followups: How did you quantify the quality risk?
What compromise (if any) did you accept?
What was the outcome?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Deliver Results (Hard Constraints)
questions.prompt: Describe a time you delivered results under severe constraints (time, people, budget, or technical limits).
followups: What did you cut and why?
How did you ensure correctness and reliability?
How did you measure success?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Earn Trust (Cross-Team)
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to earn trust across teams to deliver a shared outcome.
followups: How did you align on goals and responsibilities?
How did you handle conflict or ambiguity?
What was the outcome?
